title: Margaret Thatcher: Vol 3: Herself Alone by Charles Moore, review: What would Mrs Thatcher say to today’s parliament?
text:
Margaret Thatcher will always look like a political giant, but never more so than in a week when the fate of her beloved country rests on a decision by the European Union to grant us an extension – or not. I was in tears reading the last few pages of the third and final volume of Charles Moore’s authorised biography. Not just because the picture he paints of an epoch-shaping dynamo dwindled to an old lady with Alzheimer’s watching Songs of Praise and looking at pictures of cats is desperately sad.

The reader, who has been by her side through the triumphs and the setbacks of the preceding 850 pages (in need of several lie-downs along the exhausting route), may find themselves overcome, as I did,...
description: Margaret Thatcher will always look like a political giant, but never more so than in a week when the fate of her beloved country rests on a decision by the European Union to grant us an extension – or not.
